column1: Art Institute of Chicago////One part of the museum that continues to draw me back is the contemporary wing.  I'm not a huge modern art person since I think a lot of it looks like something a 10 year old could make up (although I love me some Rothko)
column2: but the space itself is light
column4: and spacious.  It's refreshing to see after walking through darker exhibits that have to protect older works.  Plus
column5: they often have impromptu music performances in the great hall which is always a fun surprise.  AND they sell beer in the cafe of the contemporary wing!  Beer and art = great combo.
